keyPolicies.policyDescription: Addressing complaints about parked vehicles crowding streets and footpaths by imposing restrictions to reduce pavement parking.
Organizing litter picking crews to clean up the area, making it safe for dogs and children, and preventing broken glass in parks.
Promoting a market focusing on reusable materials, crafts and recycling to support local sustainability and reduce waste.

issues.environment: Addressing climate change by reducing waste and promoting recycling through local initiatives like the Alternative Winter Market.
issues.transport: Tackling dangerous road speeds and reducing litter.

community.content: Listening to complaints about parked vehicles and addressing them through imposing restrictions.
Bringing community together with events like the Alternative Christmas Market and Green Drinks.

quotes.text: From tackling dangerous road speeds, to taking measures to reduce litter and calling for an end to pavement street parking, I’ve been acting on your concerns this autumn!

images.caption: Tay Pitman to tackle pavement parking.
Stop the Whopper! Tay campaigning against a new drive-through fast food chain on Westgate Road.
Tay at a Green Drinks event.

examples: Fly-tipping identified and removed: Tyre on Slaytford Lane and Sofa on Pease Avenue.
From tackling dangerous road speeds, to taking measures to reduce litter and calling for an end to pavement street parking, I’ve been acting on your concerns this autumn!
Keeping Fenham clean from litter not only makes the place look better, but it also keeps our green spaces safe for dogs and children.
Addressing complaints about parked vehicles crowding streets and footpaths.
Organizing litter picking crews to clean up the area.
Bringing community together with events like the Alternative Christmas Market and Green Drinks.
Addressing climate change by reducing waste and promoting recycling.

personalStories.story: Residents completing surveys indicated issues with excessive pavement parking, causing difficulties when crossing the road or maneuvering around parked vehicles.

examples: Why is Newcastle's Council not doing this in residential areas? We are happy to help residents gather evidence of impassable obstructions to show the council and police.
Tay is part of the West Fenham community and lists local places like Denton Burn as their key areas of action.
